channel.title: Your MAC Address Randomization attempts are futile!
channel.description:
Originally published at: https://www.whonix.org/blog/mac-address-randomization-fails
The following paper explains why. Why MAC Address Randomization is not Enough: An Analysis of Wi-Fi Network Discovery Mechanisms The above interesting paper has been found by HulaHoop and added to Whonix MAC address documentation.

item.title: Your MAC Address Randomization attempts are futile!
item.dc:creator: torjunkie
item.description:
Hi Patrick,

Yes - and your chats in the link below were interesting.

github.com/QubesOS/qubes-issues

Issue: MAC Randomization for iwlwifi

opened by marmarek on 2015-03-08 
Reported by andrewb on 6 Dec 2014 03:15 UTC
See https://groups.google.com/d/msg/qubes-users/Yo73MZC4038/a5ONmKpLB5YJ -- qubes-users subject "MAC randomization experiments":
On 07/17/14 13:51, Joanna Rutkowska wrote:
On...
C: other P: major enhancement help wanted privacy

Good to see some progress has been made on this issue via Bugzilla (June). There are so many weaknesses with wi-fi (see DefCon in any given year for example), that it is probably best not to use it at all.

Out of interest, I know Whonix hides the MAC addresses from the net VM in Qubes, but for fun I tried the Qubes spoofing instructions anyway.

The instructions below do not work for me (ethernet) when running Qubes-Whonix. It will always fail at 80% bootstrapping, despite presence of the service in the net VM, successful change of the MAC address when checked under ifconfig etc.

Qubes OS

Anonymizing your MAC Address

Anonymizing your MAC Address Although it is not the only metadata broadcast by network hardware, changing the default MAC Address of your hardware could be an important step in protecting privacy...

I wonder if anybody else has had luck, or is it not meant to work at all while running Whonix concurrently. I know this is total overkill, but it is always fun to play around with
